data.text: Which Tires at What Width for Bikepacking?
Which tires at what width are you all rockin'?
Pirelli Cinturato M 40mm
data.author: Suney Cheung

data.text: I have the Schwalbe g one allarounds @40. They're really grippy and pretty fast but the center of my rear is already worn down after 4 months. I ride the bike nearly daily and I'm a commuter so a lot of on road use. Probably average 10 miles a day on that bike since I bought it for Xmas

data.text: Pirrelli Gravel H (700c x 40) on my Apollo. Rolls so much faster than the stock WTB Byways. The H have actually handled dry hardpack single track really well. data.text: Went from Donnelly X'plor 40mm, with middle raised strip for road speed. Switched to Rene Herse 48mm Oracle Ridge. Thought it was a huge leap, and might really slow down my ride. Exactly opposite, they have way noticeable less road resistance, so much faster on flats and downhills on roads, And they give me extra cush at lower psi on knarly gravel terrain. Cant say enough about them. Check out their website, with some of the testing they have done.
data.author: Gary Zukowski

data.text: No issues, and I've pushed them hard through rocky sections. Most goathead punctures are in the tread patch, and those are no problem. Of the 6 sets of their tires I've used or using, I got one set of standard, and I didn't really notice the additional weight or the reduced suppleness.

data.text: Had gravelking SK 700x50 last year and loved them. This spring when I picked up my bike for the first spring ride, the front tire had delaminated rubber on one part of the tire. While waiting for that replacement tire, I'm gonna give a test ride on Goodyear Gravel Connector 700x40 we'll see how they ride.
